monitoring.explain_chart_monitoring: The chart below illustrates the parameters that yielded the highest number of results during the monitoring or search process, highlighting those with the most findings to prioritize your analysis.
monitoring.description_affiliate_emailaddr: E-mail addresses associated with affiliates or entities related to the investigated entity.
monitoring.description_internet_name: Alias, user name, nickname or public identifier that a person, entity or system uses on the Internet.
monitoring.description_username: User names (aliases or handles) found online, which could be linked to a person or entity on various websites or services.
monitoring.description_emailaddr: E-mail addresses related to an entity, found in filtered databases, forums, social networks, websites, among others.
monitoring.description_social_media: Collection of profiles and activities of an entity (person, organization, etc.) on social media platforms.
monitoring.description_blacklisted_ipaddr: An IP address associated with the domain under investigation has been detected on a blacklist.
monitoring.description_malicious_ipaddr: An IP address specifically identified as malicious due to its association with hostile or fraudulent activity on the Internet.
monitoring.description_phishing_domains: Domain names resembling the investigated entity, potentially used in phishing schemes to impersonate or mislead users associated with the targeted organization
monitoring.monitoring_times: The parameters monitoring is executed every day at 2AM.

installation_guide.title: Installation Guide
installation_guide.welcome_message: Welcome to the Agent Installation Guide! This guide provides step-by-step instructions for installing the agent on different operating systems. Whether you are deploying on Windows or Linux, you will find all the necessary steps to ensure a smooth installation process.

windows.title: Windows

steps.intro: To run the command on Windows, follow these steps:
steps.step1: Step 1: Open PowerShell with administrative privileges.
steps.step2: Step 2: Copy and paste the following command into the PowerShell window, then press Enter to execute it.
steps.note: The command will download and run the Akila Agent with the provided URL and API key.

steps.intro: To create a script for bulk installation, follow these steps:
steps.step1: Step 1: Create a new PowerShell script file with a .ps1 extension, e.g., install_agent.ps1.
steps.step2: Step 2: Copy the following script into the newly created PowerShell script file:

active_directory.title: Instructions for Active Directory Group Policy
active_directory.intro: To apply group policies in Active Directory, follow these steps:

steps.step1: Step 1: Open the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
steps.step2: Step 2: Navigate to the desired Organizational Unit (OU) or domain where you want to apply the Group Policy.
steps.step3: Step 3: Create a new Group Policy Object (GPO) or edit an existing one.
steps.step4: Step 4: Navigate to Computer Configuration > Policies > Windows Settings > Scripts (Startup/Shutdown).
steps.step5: Step 5: Add a new startup script and specify the path to your PowerShell script (e.g., instalar_agente.ps1).
steps.step6: Step 6: Ensure that the execution policy allows the script to run. You may need to set the execution policy to RemoteSigned or Bypass.
steps.step7: Step 7: Once the Group Policy is applied to the desired computers, the script will run during startup.

windows.notes: Notes: The Windows agent is compatible with Windows Server 2008 R2 and later.

steps.intro: To run the command on Linux, follow these steps:
steps.step1: Step 1: Open a terminal on your Linux system.
steps.step3: Step 3: Paste the command in the terminal window and press Enter to execute it.
steps.step4: Step 4: Copy the following command, paste it into the terminal window, and press Enter to execute it.
steps.note: The command will download and run the Akila Agent with the provided URL and API key.

error_notes.title: Error notes
error_notes.intro: If you get any `libssl` error during agent installation, you can use the following commands:
